subtitle: Supplication for one whose affairs have become difficult

ar_dua: مَا مِنْ عَبْدٍ يُذْنِبُ ذَنْباً فَيُحْسِنُ الطُّهُورَ، ثُمَّ يَقُومُ فَيُصَلِّي رَكْعَتَيْنِ، ثُمَّ يَسْتَغْفِرُاللهَ إلَّا غَفَرَ اللهُ لَهُ
en_translation: Any servant who commits a sin and as a result, performs ablution, prays two raka'ahs of Ŝalah and then seeks Allah's forgiveness, Allah would forgive him.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [1521](2/86) and At-Tirmidhî [406,3006](2/257). Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ Abî Dâwud (1/283).
subtitle: Upon committing a sin

ar_dua: الاسْتِعَاذَةُ بِاللهِ مِنْهُ
en_translation: Seek refuge in Allah from him.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud (1/206) and At-Tirmidhî. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (1/77).
subtitle: Supplications for expelling the devil and his whisperings #1

ar_dua: الأذَانُ
en_translation: The Athân (The Call to Prayer).
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [608](1/151) and Muslim [389](1/291).
subtitle: Supplications for expelling the devil and his whisperings #2

ar_dua: الأذْكَارُ وَ قِراءَةُ القُرْآنِ
en_translation: Authentic texts of remembrance and the recitation of the Qur'ân.
subtitle: Supplications for expelling the devil and his whisperings #3

ar_dua: قَدَرُ اللهِ وَما شَاءَ فَعَلَ
en_translation: Allah has decreed and what He wills, He does.
subtitle: Supplication when stricken with a mishap or overtaken by an affair

ar_dua:
بَارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ فِي الْمَوْهُوبِ لَكَ، وَ شَكَرْتَ الْوَاهِبَ، وَ بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ، وَ رُزِقْتَ بِرَّهُ
وَيَرُدُّ عَلَيْهِ المُهَنَّأ فَيَقُولُ: بَارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ، وَ بَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ، وجَزَاكَ اللهُ خَيْراً، وَرَزَقَكَ اللهُ مِثْلَهُ، وأَجْزَلَ ثَوَابَكَ
en_translation:
'May Allah bless what He allots to you (this child) and may you be grateful to the One who allots him to you. May he (this child) come to maturity and may Allah allot him the good behaviour towards you.'

Reply:' May Allah bless every thing that He allots to you ! May Allah reward you by His forgiveness, allot a new-born like mine to you and give you an abundant retribution.'
en_reference: An-Nawawî [Al-Athkâr](pg. 349). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Athkâr of Imam An-Nawawî (2/713) by Shaykh Salîm Al-Hilâlî.
subtitle: Congratulations on the occasion of a birth

ar_dua: أُعِيْذُكُمَا بِكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّةِ، مِنْ كُلِّ شَيْطَانٍ وَهـَامَّةٍ، وَمِنْ كُلِّ عَيْنٍ لامَّةٍ
en_translation: I commend you to the protection of Allah’s perfect words from every devil, vermin, and every evil eye.
subtitle: Placing children under Allah's protection

ar_dua: لَا بأْسَ طَهُورٌ إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ
en_translation: Never mind, may it (the sickness) be a purification, if Allah wills.
subtitle: When visiting the sick #1

ar_dua: أَسْأَلُ اللهَ العَظِيْمَ، رَبَّ العَرْشِ العَظِيْمِ، أَنْ يَشْفِيَكَ [سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ]
en_translation: I ask Allah The Supreme, Lord of the magnificent throne to cure you. (Seven times)
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [2083] and Abû Dâwud [3106]. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (2/210) and Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [5766](5/180).
subtitle: When visiting the sick #2

ar_dua: إذَا عَادَ الرَّجُلُ أخَاهُ المُسْلِمَ، مَشَى فِي خِرَافَةِ الجَنَّةِ حَتَّى يَجْلِسَ، فَإذَا جَلَسَ غَمَرَتْهُ الرَّحْمَةُ،  فَإنْ كَانَ غُدْوَةً صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ سَبْعُونَ ألْفَ مَلَكٍ حَتَّى يُمْسِيَ، و إنْ كَانَ مَسَاءً صَلَّى عَلَيْهِ سَبْعُونَ ألْفَ مَلَكٍ حَتَّى يُصْبِحَ
en_translation: If a man calls on his sick Muslim brother, it is as if he walks reaping the fruits of Paradise until he sits, and when he sits he is showered in mercy, and if this was in the morning, seventy thousand angles send prayers upon him until the evening, and if this was in the evening, seventy thousand angles send prayers upon him until the morning.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [969], Ibn Mâjah [1442] and Aĥmad (1/97). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (1/244) and Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (1/286). Shaykh Aĥmad Shâkir also authenticated it.
subtitle: Excellence of visiting the sick

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالرَّفِيْقِ الأعْلَى
en_translation: O Allah, forgive me, have mercy upon me and unite me with the higher companions.
subtitle: Supplication of the sick who have renounced all hope of life #1

ar_dua: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللهُ، إِنَّ لِلْمَوْتِ لَسَكَرَاتٍ
en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, death does indeed contain agony.
subtitle: Supplication of the sick who have renounced all hope of life #2

ar_dua: لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وَاللهُ أَكْبَرُ، لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وحْدَهُ، لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لهُ، لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ لَهُ المُلْكُ ولَهُ الحَمْدُ، لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ، وَلَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللهِ
en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah and Allah is the greatest.None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone.None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner.None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah and there is no might and no power except with Allah.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3430] and Ibn Mâjah [3794]. Al-Albânî authenticated it. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/152) and Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (2/317).
subtitle: Supplication of the sick who have renounced all hope of life #3

ar_dua: لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ
en_translation: He, whose last words are 'None has the right to be worshipped except Allah', will enter Jannah.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [3116](3/190). Also See Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [6479](5/432).
subtitle: Instruction for the one nearing death

ar_dua: إِنَّا لِلهِ وَ إِنَّا إِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُونَ، اللَّهُمَّ أجُرْنِي فِي مُصِيْبَتِي، وَ أخْلِفْ لِي خَيْراً مِنْهَا
en_translation: To Allah we belong and unto Him is our return.O Allah, recompense me for my affliction and replace it for me with something better.
subtitle: Supplication for one afflicted by a calamity

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِفُلانٍ (باسْمِهِ)، وَارْفَعْ دَرَجَتَهُ في المَهْدِيِّيْنَ، وَاخْلُفْهُ في عَقِبِهِ في الغَابِرِيْنَ، وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَلَهُ يَا رَبَّ العَالَمِيْنَ، وَافْسَحْ لَهُ في قَبْرِهِ وَنَوِّرْ لَهُ فِيْهِ
en_translation: O Allah, forgive (name of deceased) and raise his rank among the rightly guided, and be a successor to whom he has left behind, and forgive us and him O Lord of the worlds. Make spacious his grave and illuminate it for him.
subtitle: When closing the eyes of the deceased

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ وَارْحَمْهُ، وَعافِهِ، وَاعْفُ عَنْهُ، وَأَكْرِمْ نُزُلَهُ، وَوَسِّعْ مُدْخَلَهُ، وَاغْسِلْهُ بِالْمَاءِ وَالثَّـلْجِ وَالْبَرَدِ، وَنَقِّهِ مِنَ الْخَطَايَا كَمَا نَقَّيْتَ الثَّوْبَ الأَبْيَضَ مِنَ الدَّنَسِ، وَأَبْدِلْهُ داراً خَيْراً مِنْ دَارِهِ، وَأَهْلاً خَيْراً مِنْ أَهْلِهِ، وَزَوْجَاً خَيْراً مِنْ زَوْجِهِ، وَأَدْخِلْهُ الْجَنَّةَ، وَأَعِذْهُ مِنْ عَذَابِ القَبْرِ(وَ عَذَابِ النَّارِ)
en_translation: O Allah, forgive and have mercy upon him, excuse him and pardon him, and make honourable his reception. Expand his entry, and cleanse him with water, snow, and ice, and purify him of sin as a white robe is purified of filth. Exchange his home for a better home, and his family for a better family, and his spouse for a better spouse. Admit him into the Garden, protect him from the punishment of the grave (and the torment of the Fire).
subtitle: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer #1

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِحَيِّنَا، وَمَيِّتِنَا، وَشَاهِدِنَا، وَغَائِبِنَا، وَصَغِيْرِنَا، وَكَبِيْرِنَا، وَذَكَرِنَا، وَأُنْثَانَا، اللَّهُمَّ مَنْ أَحْيَيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَأَحْيِهِ عَلَى الإِسْلامِ، وَمَنْ تَوَفَّيْتَهُ مِنَّا فَتَوَفَّهُ عَلَى الإِيْمَانِ، اللَّهُمَّ لَا تَحْرِمْنَا أَجْرَهُ، وَلَا تُضِلَّنَا بَعْدَهُ
en_translation: O Allah, forgive our living and our dead, those present and those absent, our young and our old, our males and our females. O Allah, whom amongst us You keep alive, then let such a life be upon Islam, and whom amongst us You take unto Yourself, then let such a death be upon faith. O Allah, do not deprive us of his reward and do not let us stray after him.
en_reference: Ibn Mâjah [1498](1/480), Abû Dâwud [3201], At-Tirmidhî [1024], An-Nisâ'i [1988] and Aĥmad (2/368). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (1/251).
subtitle: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer #2

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّ فُلانَ بْنَ فُلانٍ في ذِمَّتِكَ، وَحَبْلِ جِوارِكَ، فَقِهِ مِنْ فِتْنَةِ الْقَبْرِ وَعَذَابِ النَّارِ، وَأَنْتَ أَهْلُ الْوَفاءِ وَالْحَقِّ، فَاغْفِرْ لَهُ، وَارْحَمْهُ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الغَفُورُ الرَّحِيْمُ
en_translation: O Allah, so-and-so is under Your care and protection so protect him from the trial of the grave and torment of the Fire. Indeed You are faithful and truthful. Forgive and have mercy upon him, surely You are The Oft-Forgiving, The Most-Merciful.
en_reference: Ibn Mâjah [1499] and Abû Dâwud (3/211). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (1/251).
subtitle: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer #3

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ عَبْدُكَ وَابْنُ أَمَتِكَ، احْتَاجَ إِلى رَحْمَتِكَ، وَأَنْتَ غَنِيٌّ عَنْ عَذَابِهِ، إِنْ كَانَ مُحْسِناً فَزِدْ في حَسَنَاتِهِ، وَإِنْ كَانَ مُسِيْئاً فَتَجَاوَزْ عَنْهُ
en_translation: O Allah, Your servant and the son of Your maidservant is in need of Your mercy and You are without need of his punishment. If he was righteous then increase his reward and if he was wicked then look over his sins.
en_reference: Al-Hâkim (1/359 )and he authenticated it and Adh-Dhahabî agreed with him. Also see Aĥkâm Al-Janâ'iz by Al-Albânî (pg. 125).
subtitle: Supplication for the deceased at the funeral prayer #4

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ فَرَطاً وَذُخْراً لِوالِدَيْهِ، وَشَفِيْعاً مُجَاباً، اللَّهُمَّ ثَقِّلْ بِهِ مَوَازِيْنَهُمَا، وَأَعْظِمْ بِهِ أُجـُورَهُمَا، وَأَلْحِقْهُ بِصَالِحِ المُؤْمِنِيْنَ، وَاجْعَلْهُ في كَفَالَةِ إِبْرَاهـِيْمَ، وَقِهِ بِرَحْمَتِكَ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيْمِ، و أبْدِلْهُ دَاراً خَيْراً مِنْ دَارِهِ، و أهْلاً خَيْراً مِنْ أهْلِهِ، اللهم اغْفِرْ لأسْلاَفِنَا، وَ أفْرَاطِنَا، وَ مَنْ سَبَقَنَا باِلإيْمَانِ
en_translation: O Lord, make him a preceding reward and a stored treasure for his parents, and an answered intercessor. O Allah, through him, make heavy their scales and magnify their reward. Unite him with the righteous believers, place him under the care of Ibraheem, and protect him by Your mercy from the torment of Hell. Give him in exchange a better residence and a better family than his. O Allah, forgive our ancestors and our descendants and those who came before us with faith.
en_reference: See Al-Mughnî by Ibn Qudâmah (3/416) and Ad-Durûs  Al-Muhimmah Li'âmah Al-Ummah by Shaykh Ibn Bâz (pg. 15).
subtitle: Supplication for the deceased child at the funeral prayer #1

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ لَنَا فَرَطاً، وَسَلَفاً، وَأَجْراً
en_translation: O Allah, make him a preceding reward, a prepayment and a recompense for us.
en_reference: Al-Baghawî [Sharĥ As-Sunnah](5/357).
subtitle: Supplication for the deceased child at the funeral prayer #2

ar_dua: إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا أَخَذَ، وَلَهُ مَا أَعْطَى، وَكُلُّ شَيءٍ عِنْدَهُ بِأَجَلٍ مُسَمَّىً...فَلْتَصْبِرْ وَ لْتَحْتَسِبْ
en_translation: Verily to Allah, belongs what He took and to Him belongs what He gave, and everything with Him has an appointed time.
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [1284](2/80) and Muslim [923](2/636).
subtitle: Condolence

ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللهِ، وَعَلَى سُنَّةِ رَسُولِ اللهِ
en_translation: In the name of Allah and upon the sunnah of the Messenger of Allah.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [3213](3/314) with a Ŝaĥîĥ chain and Aĥmad (2/40) with the phrase: (بسم الله و على ملة رسول الله) and its chain is Ŝaĥîĥ.
subtitle: Placing the deceased in the grave

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لَهُ، اللَّهُمَّ ثَبِّتْهُ
en_translation: O Allah, forgive him, O Allah, protect him.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [3221](3/315) and Al-Hâkim (1/370) and he authenticated it and Adh-Dhahabî agreed with him.
subtitle: After burying the deceased

ar_dua: السَّلَامُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ الدِّيَارِ، مِنَ المُؤْمِنِيْنَ، وَالْمُسْلِمِيْنَ، وَإِنَّا إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ بِكُمْ لَاحِقُونَ، [وَ يَرْ حَمُ اللهُ المُسْتَقْدِمِيْنَ مِنَّا وَ المُسْتَأخِرِيْنَ] أسْألُ اللهَ لَنَا وَلَكُمْ العَافِيَةَ
en_translation: Peace be upon you all, O inhabitants of the graves, amongst the believers and the Muslims. Verily we will, Allah willing, be united with you, we ask Allah for well-being for us and you.
en_reference: Muslim [975](2/671) and Ibn Mâjah [1547](1/494) and the wording is his. What is between the brackets is from the hadith of 'Â'ishah collected by Muslim [974](2/671).
subtitle: Visiting the graves

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا
en_translation: O Allah, I ask You for it’s goodness and I take refuge with You from it’s evil.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [5097](4/326) and Ibn Mâjah [3727](2/1228). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (2/305).
subtitle: Prayer said during a wind storm #1

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا، وَخَيْرَ مَا فِيْهَا، وَخَيْرَ مَا اُرْسِلَتْ بِهِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَـرِّهَا، وَشَرِّ مَا فِيْهَا، وَشَرِّ مَا اُرْسِلَتْ بِهِ
en_translation: O Allah, I ask You for it’s goodness, the good within it, and the good it was sent with, and I take refuge with You from it’s evil, the evil within it, and from the evil it was sent with.
en_reference: Muslim [899](2/616) and Al-Bukhârî [3206](4/76).
subtitle: Prayer said during a wind storm #2

ar_dua: سُبْحَانَ الَّذِي يُسَبِّحُ الرَّعْدُ بِحَمْدِهِ، وَالمَلائِكَةُ مِنْ خِيْفَتِهِ
en_translation: How perfect He is, (The One) Whom the thunder declares His perfection with His praise, as do the angles out of fear of Him.
en_reference: Al-Muwaťťa' (2/992) and Al-Albânî declared its chain to be Ŝaĥîĥ and Mawqûf.
subtitle: Supplication upon hearing thunder

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ أَسْقِنَا غَيْثاً مُغِيْثاً مَرِيْئاً مَرِيْعاً، نَافِعاً، غَيْرَ ضَارٍّ، عاجِلاً غَيْرَ آجِلٍ
en_translation: O Allah, send upon us helpful, wholesome and healthy rain, beneficial not harmful rain, now, not later.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [1169](1/303). Al-Albânî declared it authentic in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (1/216).
subtitle: Supplication for rain #1

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ أَغِثْنَا، اللَّهُمَّ أَغِثْنَا، اللَّهُمَّ أَغِثْنَا
en_translation: O Allah, relieve us, O Allah, relieve us, O Allah, relieve us.
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [1013](1/224) and Muslim [897](2/613).
subtitle: Supplication for rain #2

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ اسْقِ عِبَادَكَ، وَبَهَائِمَكَ، وَانْشُرْ رَحْمَتَكَ، وَأَحْيِيْ بَلَدَكَ المَيِّتَ
en_translation: O Allah, provide water for Your servants and Your cattle, spread out Your mercy and resurrect Your dead land.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [1176](1/305) and Al-Albânî declared it Ĥasan in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (1/218).
subtitle: Supplication for rain #3

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ صَيِّباً نَافِعاً
en_translation: O Allah, may it be a beneficial rain cloud.
subtitle: Supplication when it is raining

ar_dua: مُطِرْنَا بِفَضْلِ اللهِ وَرَحْمَتِهِ
en_translation: We have been given rain by the grace and mercy of Allah.
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [846](1/205) and Muslim [71](1/83).
subtitle: Supplication after rain

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ حَوَالَيْنَا وَلَا عَلَيْنَا، اللَّهُمَّ عَلَى الآكَامِ وَالظِّرَابِ، وَبُطُونِ الأوْدِيَةِ، وَمَنَابِتِ الشَّجَرِ
en_translation: O Allah, let the rain fall around us and not upon us, O Allah, (let it fall) on the pastures, hills, valleys and the roots of trees.
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [1013](1/224) and Muslim [897](2/614).
subtitle: Asking for clear skies

ar_dua: اللهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللَّهُمَّ أَهِلَّهُ عَلَيْنَا بِالأمْنِ وَالإيْمَانِ، والسَّلامَةِ والإسْلامِ، وَالتَّوْفِيْقِ لِمَا تُحِبُّ رَبَّنَا وَتَرْضَى، رَبُّنَا وَرَبُّكَ اللهُ
en_translation: Allah is the greatest. O Allah, let the crescent loom above us in safety, faith, peace, and Islam, and in agreement with all that You love and pleases You. Our Lord and your Lord is Allah.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3451](5/405) and Ad-Dârimî (1/336) and the wording is his. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/157).
subtitle: Upon sighting the crescent moon

ar_dua: ذَهَبَ الظَّمَأُ، وَابْتَلَّتِ العُرُوقُ، وَثَبَتَ الأجْرُ إِنْ شَاءَ اللهُ
en_translation: The thirst has gone and the veins are quenched, and reward is confirmed, if Allah wills.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [2357](2/306). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [4678](4/209).
subtitle: Upon breaking fast #1

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ بِرَحْمَتِكَ الَّتِي وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ، أَنْ تَغْفِرَ لِي
en_translation: O Allah, I ask You by Your mercy which envelopes all things, that You forgive me.
en_reference: Ibn Mâjah [1753](1/557) and Al-Hâfiž declared it Ĥasan in this takhrîj of Al-Athkâr. Also see Sharĥ Al-Athkâr (4/342).
subtitle: Upon breaking fast #2

ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللهِ (في أَوَّلِهِ وَآخِرِهِ)
en_translation: In the name of Allah (in its beginning and end)*.
en_reference:
* The words in the bracket are to be said if one forgets to recite the dua before eating and remembers while eating.
Abû Dâwud [3767](3/347) and At-Tirmidhî [1858](4/288). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (2/167).
subtitle: Supplication before eating #1

ar_dua:
(١) اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيْهِ، وَأَطْعِمْنَا خَيْراً مِنْهُ
(٢) اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِيْهِ، وَزِدْنَا مِنْهُ
en_translation:
(1) 'O Allah, bless it for us and feed us better than it.'

If one is given milk, recite the following instead:
(2) 'O Allah, bless it fo it for usand give us more of it.'
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [3767] and An-Nisâ'i ['Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah][282]. Al-Albânî declared it weak, see Al-Kalam Ať-Ťayyib [184].
subtitle: Supplication before eating #2

ar_dua: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي أَطْعَمَنِي هـَذَا، وَرَزَقَنِيْهِ، مِنْ غَيْرِ حَوْلٍ مِنِّي وَلَا قُوَّةٍ
en_translation: All praise is for Allah who fed me this and provided it for me without any might nor power from myself.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [4023], At-Tirmidhî [3458] and Ibn Mâjah [3285]. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/159).
subtitle: Upon completion of a meal #1

ar_dua: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ حَمْداً كَثِيْراً طَيِّباً مُبَارَكاً فِيْهِ، غَيْرَ [مَكْفِيٍّ وَلَا] مُوَدَّعٍ، وَلَا مُسْتَغْنىً عَنْهُ رَبُّنَا
en_translation: Allah be praised with an abundant beautiful blessed praise, a never-ending praise, a praise which we will never bid farewell to and an indispensable praise, He is our Lord.
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [5458](6/214) and At-Tirmidhî [3456](5/507) and the wording is his.
subtitle: Upon completion of a meal #2

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَهُمْ فِيْمَا رَزَقْتَهُمْ، وَاغْفِرْ لَهُمْ، وَارْحَمْهُمْ
en_translation: O Allah, bless for them, that which You have provided them, forgive them and have mercy upon them.
subtitle: Supplication of the guest for the host

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ أَطْعِمْ مَنْ أَطْعَمَنِي، وَاسْقِ مَنْ سَقَانِي
en_translation: O Allah, feed him who fed me, and provide with drink him who provided me with drink.
subtitle: Supplication said to one offering a drink or to one who intended to do that

ar_dua: أَفْطَرَ عِنْدَكُمُ الصَّائِمُونَ، وَأَكَلَ طَعَامَكُمُ الأبْرَارُ، وَصَلَّتْ عَلَيْكُمُ المَلائِكَةُ
en_translation: May the fasting break their fast in your home, and may the dutiful and pious eat your food, and may the angles send prayers upon you.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [3854](3/367), Ibn Mâjah [1747](1/556) and An-Nisâ'i ['Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah][296-298]. Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (2/730).
subtitle: Supplication said when breaking fast in someone's home

ar_dua: إذَا دُعِيَ أحَدُكُمْ فَلْيُجِبْ، فَإنْ كَانَ صَائِمًا فَلْيُصَلِّ، وَ إنْ كَانَ مُفْطِراً فَلْيَطْعَمْ (وَ مَعنَى فَلْيُصَلِّ؛ أيْ: فَلْيَدْعُ)
en_translation: If you are invited (to a meal) then accept. If you happen to be fasting, then pray (for those present) and if you are not fasting, then eat. (The meaning of 'pray' here means 'supplicate').
subtitle: Supplication said by one fasting when presented with food and does not break his fast

ar_dua: إِنِّي صَائِمٌ، إِنِّي صَائِمٌ
en_translation: I am fasting, I am fasting.
subtitle: If insulted while fasting #1

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ بَارِكْ لَنَا فِي ثَمَرِنَا، وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي مَدِيْنَتِنَا، وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي صَاعِنَا، وَبَارِكْ لَنَا فِي مُدِّنَا
en_translation: O Allah, bless our fruit for us, bless our town for us, bless our saAA for us and bless our mudd for us.
subtitle: Supplication said upon seeing the early or premature fruit

ar_dua:
(١) الْحَمْدُ للهِ 
(٢) يَرْحَمُكَ اللهُ
(٣) يَهْدِيْكُمُ اللهُ وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُمْ
en_translation: When one of you sneezes, say : (1) 'All praise if for Allah.', then his brother or companion should reply: (2) 'May Allah have mercy upon you.' and the one who sneezed replies back by saying (3) 'May Allah guide you and rectify your condition.'
subtitle: Supplication said upon sneezing

ar_dua: يَهْدِيْكُمُ اللهُ، وَيُصْلِحُ بَالَكُمْ
en_translation: May Allah guide you and rectify your condition.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [2739](5/82), Aĥmad (4/400) and Abû Dâwud [5038](4/308). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (2/354).
subtitle: What to say to a kâfir who praises Allah after sneezing

ar_dua: بَارَكَ اللّهُ لَكَ، وَبَارَكَ عَلَيْكَ، وَجَمَعَ بَيْنَكُمَا فِي خَيْرٍ
en_translation: May Allah bless for you (your spouse) and bless you, and may He unite both of you in goodness.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [2130], At-Tirmidhî [1091], and Ibn Mâjah [1905]. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (1/324).
subtitle: Supplication said to the newly wed

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَهَا، وَخَيْرَ مَا جَبَلْتَهَا عَلَيْهِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّهَا، وَشَرِّ مَا جَبَلْتَهَا عَلَيْهِ
en_translation: O Allah, I ask You for the goodness within her and the goodness that you have made her inclined towards, and I take refuge with You from the evil within her and the evil that you have made her inclined towards.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [2160](2/248) and Ibn Mâjah [1918](1/617). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (1/324).
subtitle: The groom's supplication on the wedding night or when buying an animal

ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللهِ، اللَّهُمَّ جَنِّبْنَا الشَّيْطَانَ، وَجَنِّبِ الشَّيْطانَ مَا رَزَقْتَنَا
en_translation: In the name of Allah. O Allah, keep the devil away from us and keep the devil away from what you have blessed us with.
subtitle: Supplication before sexual intercourse

ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بِاللهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ
en_translation: I take refuge with Allah from the accursed devil.
subtitle: When angry

ar_dua: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِيْ عَافَانِي مِمَّا ابْتَلاكَ بِهِ، وَفَضَّلَنِي عَلَى كَثِيْرٍ مِمَّنْ خَلَقَ تَفْضِيْلاً
en_translation: All praise is for Allah Who saved me from that which He tested you with and Who most certainly favoured me over much of His creation.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3432](5/493,494). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/153).
subtitle: Supplication said upon seeing someone in trial or tribulation

ar_dua: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لي، وَتُبْ عَلَـيَّ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ التَّوَّابُ الغَفُورُ
en_translation: O my Lord, forgive me and turn towards me (to accept my repentance). Verily You are The Oft-Returning. The Oft-Forgiving.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3432]. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/153) and Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (2/321) and the wording is At-Tirmidhî's.
subtitle: Remembrance said at a sitting or gathering, etc...

ar_dua: سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ وَبِحَمْدِكَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ، أَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْكَ
en_translation: How perfect You are O Allah, and I praise You. I bear witness that None has the right to be worshipped except You. I seek Your forgiveness and turn to You in repentance.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [4859], At-Tirmidhî [3433], An-Nisâ'i ['Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah][397]. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/153).
subtitle: Supplication for the expiation of sins said at the conclusion of a sitting or gathering, etc...

ar_dua: وَلَكَ
en_translation: And (may Allah forgive) you.
en_reference: Aĥmad (5/82) and An-Nisâ'i ['Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah](pg. 218).
subtitle: Replying to a supplication of forgiveness #1

ar_dua: جَزَاكَ اللهُ خَيْراً
en_translation: May Allah reward you with good.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [2035]. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [6244] and Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (2/200).
subtitle: Supplication said to one who does you a favor

ar_dua: مَنْ حَفِظَ عَشَرَ آيَاتٍ مِنْ أوُّلِ سُورَةِ الكَهْفِ، عُصِمَ مِنَ الدَّجَّالِ
en_translation: Whoever memorises the first ten verses of Sûrah Al-Kahf will be protected from the Dajjâl.
subtitle: Protection from the Dajjâl

ar_dua: أَحَبَّكَ الَّذِيْ أَحْبَبْتَنِي لَهُ
en_translation: May He, for whom you have loved me, love you.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [5125](4/333) and Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (3/965).
subtitle: Supplication said to one who pronounces his love for you, for Allah's sake

ar_dua: بَارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ في أَهْلِكَ وَمالِكَ
en_translation: May Allah bless for you, your family and wealth.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [5125](4/333) and Al-Albânî declared it Ĥasan in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (3/965).
subtitle: Supplication said to one who has offered you some of his wealth

ar_dua: بَارَكَ اللهُ لَكَ في أَهْلِكَ وَمالِك، إِنَّمَا جَزَاءُ السَّلَفِ الْحَمْدُ والأَدَاءُ
en_translation: May Allah bless for you, your family and wealth. Surely commendation and payment are the reward for a loan.
en_reference: An-Nisâ'i ['Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah][372](pg. 300) and Ibn Mâjah [2424](2/809). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (2/55).
subtitle: Supplication said to the debtor when his debt is settled

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُبِكَ أَنْ أُشْرِكَ بِكَ وَأَنَا أَعْلَمُ، وَأَسْتَغْفِرُكَ لِمَا لَا أَعْلَمُ
en_translation: O Allah, I take refuge in You lest I should commit shirk with You knowingly and I seek Your forgiveness for what I do unknowingly.
en_reference: Aĥmad (4/403). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [3731](3/233) and Ŝaĥîĥ At-Targhîb wa At-Tarhîb [36](1/122) by Al-Albânî.
subtitle: Supplication for fear of Shirk

ar_dua: وَفِيْكَ بَارَكَ اللهُ
en_translation: May Allah bless you.
en_reference: Ibn As-Sunnî [278](pg. 138). Also see Ibn Qayyim [Al-Wabil Aŝ-Ŝayyib](pg. 304) with research by Bashîr Muĥammad 'Uyun.
subtitle: Returning a supplication after having bestowed a gift or charity upon someone

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ لَا طَيْرَ إِلَّا طَيْرُكَ، وَلَا خَيْرَ إِلَّا خَيْرُكَ، وَلَا إِلَهَ غَيْرُكَ
en_translation: O Allah, there is no omen but there is reliance on You, there is no good except Your good and none has the right to be worshipped except You.
en_reference: Aĥmad (2/220), Ibn As-Sunnî [292] and Al-Albânî authenticated it in [Al-Aḥâdīth Aŝ-Ŝaĥîĥah][1065](3/54). The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) liked Al-Fa'al [الفأل](good omens). When he heard a good word from a man, he liked it and said: "We took your good omens from your mouth", narrated by Abû Dâwud [3917] and Imâm Aĥmad; and Al-Albânî authenticated it in [Al-Aḥâdīth Aŝ-Ŝaĥîĥah](2/363). This narration can also be found in Abu As-Shaykh's book [Akhlâq An-Nabî (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam)] (p. 270).
subtitle: Forbiddance of ascribing things to omens

ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ﴿سُبْحَانَ الَّذِيْ سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِيْنَ، وَإِنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنْقَلِبُونَ﴾ الحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، الحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، الحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، اللهُ أكْبَرُ، اللهُ أكْبَرُ، اللهُ أكْبَرُ، سُبْحَانَكَ اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِيْ، فَاغْفِرْ لِي، فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
en_translation: In the name of Allah and all praise is for Allah. How perfect He is, the One Who has placed this (transport) at our service and we ourselves would not have been capable of that, and to our Lord is our final destiny. All praise is for Allah, All praise is for Allah, All praise is for Allah, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest. How perfect You are, O Allah, verily I have wronged my soul, so forgive me, for surely none can forgive sins except You.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [2602](3/34) and At-Tirmidhî [3446](5/510). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/156).
subtitle: Supplication said when mounting an animal or any means of transport

ar_dua:
(١) اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ ﴿سُبْحَانَ الَّذِيْ سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِيْنَ، وَإِنَّا إِلَى رَبِّنَا لَمُنْقَلِبُونَ﴾ اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَسْأَلُكَ فِي سَفَرِنَا هَذَا الْبِرَّ وَالتَّقْوَى، وَمِنَ الْعَمَلِ مَا تَرْضَى، اللَّهُمَّ هَوِّنْ عَلَيْنَا سَفَرَنَا هَذَا وَاطْوِعَنَّا بُعْدَهُ، اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ الصَّاحِبُ فِي السَّفَرِ، وَالْخَلِيْفَةُ فِي الأَهْلِ، اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوْذُ بِكَ مِنْ وَعْثَاءِ السَّفَرِ، وَكآبَةِ الْمَنْظَرِ وَسُوءِ المُنْقَلَبِ فِي الْمَالِ وَالأَهْلِ
(٢) آيِبُونَ، تَائِبُونَ، عَابِدُونَ، لِرَبِّنَا حَامِدُونَ
en_translation:
(1) Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, How perfect He is, The One Who has placed this (transport) at our service, and we ourselves would not have been capable of that, and to our Lord is our final destiny. O Allah, we ask You for birr and taqwa in this journey of ours, and we ask You for deeds which please You. O Allah, facilitate our journey and let us cover it’s distance quickly. O Allah, You are The Companion on the journey and The Successor over the family, O Allah, I take refuge with You from the difficulties of travel, from having a change of hearts and being in a bad predicament, and I take refuge in You from an ill fated outcome with wealth and family.

Upon returning the same supplication is recited with the following addition:
(2) 'We return, repent, worship and praise our Lord.'
subtitle: Supplication for travel

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ السَّمَوَاتِ السَّبْعِ وَمَا أَظْلَلْنَ، وَرَبَّ الأَرْاضِيْنَ السَّبْعِ وَمَا أقْلَلْنَ، وَرَبَّ الشَّيَاطِيْنِ وَمَا أَضْلَلْنَ، وَرَبَّ الرِّيَاحِ وَمَا ذَرَيْنَ، أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذِهِ الْقَرْيَةِ وَخَيْرَ أَهْلِهَا، وَخَيْرَ مَا فِيْهَا، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَـرِّهَا، وَشَرِّ أَهْلِهَا، وَشَرِّ مَا فِيْهَا
en_translation: O Allah, Lord of the seven heavens and all that they envelop, Lord of the seven earths and all that they carry, Lord of the devils and all whom they misguide, Lord of the winds and all whom they whisk away. I ask You for the goodness of this village, the goodness of its inhabitants and for all the goodness found within it and I take refuge with You from the evil of this village, the evil of its inhabitants and from all the evil found within it.
en_reference: Al-Hâkim (2/100) and he authenticated it and Adh-Dhahabî agreed with him, Ibn As-Sunnî [524], Al-Hâfiž declared it Ĥasan in Takrîj Al-Athkâr (5/154). Shaykh Ibn Bâz said that it has been narrated by An-Nisâ'i ['Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah][547-548] with a Ĥasan chain. Also see Tuĥfat Al-Akhyâr (pg. 37).
subtitle: Supplication upon entering a town or village, etc...

ar_dua: لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ المُلْكُ وَلَهُ الحَمْدُ، يُحْيِي وَيُمِيْتُ، وَهُوَ حَيٌّ لَا يَمُوتُ، بِيَدِهِ الْخَيْرُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ
en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner, to Him belongs all sovereignty and praise. He gives life and causes death, and He is living and does not die. In His hand is all good and He is over all things, omnipotent.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3429](5/291), Al-Hâkim (1/538) and Ibn Mâjah [2235]. Al-Albânî classed it as Ĥasan in Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (2/21) and Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/152).
subtitle: When entering the market

ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللهِ
en_translation: In the name of Allah.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [4982](4/296). Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (3/941).
subtitle: Supplication for when the mounted animal (or means of transport) stumbles

ar_dua: أَسْتَوْدِعُكُمُ اللَّهَ، الَّذِيْ لَا تَضِيْعُ وَدَائِعُهُ
en_translation: I place you in the trust of Allah, whose trust is never misplaced.
en_reference: Aĥmad (2/403) and Ibn Mâjah [2825](2/943). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (2/133).
subtitle: Supplication of the traveller for the resident

ar_dua: أَسْتَوْدِعُ اللَّهَ دِيْنَكَ، وَأَمَانَتَكَ، وَخَوَاتِيْمَ عَمَلِكَ
en_translation: I place your religion, your faithfulness and the ends of your deeds in the trust of Allah.
en_reference: Aĥmad (2/7) and At-Tirmidhî [3443](5/499). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (2/155).
subtitle: Supplication of the resident for the traveller #1

ar_dua: زَوَّدَكَ اللَّهُ التَّقْوَى، وَغَفَرَذَنْبَكَ، وَيَسَّرَ لَكَ الخَيْرَ حَيْثُمَا كُنْتَ
en_translation: May Allah endow you with taqwa, forgive your sins and facilitate all good for you, wherever you be.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3444]. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/155).
subtitle: Supplication of the resident for the traveller #2

ar_dua:
(١) اللهُ أَكْبَرُ

(٢) سُبْحَانَ اللهُ
en_translation: When ascending, recite (1) 'Allah is the greatest', and when descending, recite (2) 'How perfect is Allah'.
subtitle: Remembrance while ascending or descending

ar_dua: سَمَّعَ سَامِعٌ بِحَمْدِ اللهِ، وَحُسْنِ بَلائِهِ عَلَيْنَا،.رَبَّنَا صَاحِبْنَا، وَأَفْضِلْ عَلَيْنَا عَائِذاً باللهِ مِنَ النَّارِ
en_translation: May a witness, be witness to our praise of Allah for His favours and bounties upon us. Our Lord, protect us, show favour on us and deliver us from every evil. I take refuge in Allah from the fire.
subtitle: Prayer of the traveller as dawn approaches

ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللّهِِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
en_translation: I take refuge in Allah’s perfect words from the evil that He has created.
subtitle: Stopping or lodging somewhere

ar_dua: اللهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللهُ أَكْبَرُ، اللهُ أَكْبَرُ، لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لهُ، لهُ المُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الحَمْدُ، وهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ، آيِبُونَ، تَائِبُونَ، عَابِدُونَ، لِرَبِّنَا حـَامِدُونَ، صَدَقَ اللهُ وَعْدَهُ، وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ، وَهَزَمَ الأحْزَابَ وَحْدَهُ
en_translation: Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest, Allah is the greatest. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs all sovereignty and praise, and He is over all things omnipotent. We return, repent, worship and praise our Lord. Allah fulfilled His promise, aided His Servant, and single-handedly defeated the allies.
subtitle: While returning from travel

ar_dua:
(١) الحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِيْ بِنِعْمَتِهِ تَتِمُّ الصَّالِحَاتُ
(٢) الحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ عَلَى كُلِّ حَالٍ
en_translation:
Upon receiving good news, say: (1) 'All Praise is for Allah by whose favour good works are accomplished.'

Upon receiving bad news, say: (2) 'All Praise is for Allah in all circumstances.'
en_reference: Ibn As-Sunnî ['Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah][378] and Al-Hâkim (1/499) and he authenticated it. Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [4640](4/201).
subtitle: Supplication after receiving good or bad news

ar_dua: قَالَ ﷺ: «مَنْ صَلَّ عَلَيَّ صَلاةً صَلَّ اللهُ عَلَيْهِ بِهَا عَشَراً»
en_translation: The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said: 'Whoever sends a prayer upon me, Allah sends ten upon him.'
subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #1

ar_dua: قَالَ ﷺ: «لا تَجْعَلُوا قَبْرِيْ عِيْداً وَ صَلُّوا عَلَيَّ فَإِنَّ صَلاتَكُمْ تَبْلُغُنِي حَيْثُ كُنْتُمْ»
en_translation: The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said: 'Do not take my grave as a place of habitual ceremony. Send prayers upon me, for verily your prayers reach me wherever you are.'
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [2042](2/218) and Aĥmad (2/367). Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (2/383).
subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #2

ar_dua: قَالَ ﷺ: «البَخِيْلُ مَنْ ذُكِرْتُ عِنْدَهُ فَلَمْ يُصَلِّ عَلَيَّ»
en_translation: The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said : 'A miser is one whom when I am mentioned to him, fails to send prayers upon me.'
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3546](5/551). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [2787](3/25) and Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/177).
subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #3

ar_dua: قَالَ ﷺ: «إنَّ لِلَّهِ مَلائِكَةً سَيَّا حِيْنَ فِي الأرْضِ، يُبَلِّغُونِي مِنْ أُمَّتِي السَّلامَ»
en_translation: The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said: 'Allah exalted He is has got angels scouring the earth to spread the salutations of my community.'
en_reference: An-Nisâ'i (3/43) and Al-Hâkim (2/421). Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ An-Nisâ'i (1/274).
subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #4

ar_dua: قَالَ ﷺ: «مَا مِنْ أحَدٍ يُسَلِّمُ عَلَيَّ، إلَّا رَدَّ اللهُ عَلَيَّ رُوْحي، حَتَّى أرُدَّ عَلَيْهِ السَّلامَ»
en_translation: The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said: 'Every time somebody greets me, Allah gives me back my soul for me to answer this greeting.'
en_reference: Abû Dâwud (2041). Al-Albânî declared it Ĥasan in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (1/283).
subtitle: Excellence of sending prayers upon the Prophet (May Allah send blessings and peace upon him) #5

ar_dua: قَالَ ﷺ: «لا تَدْخُلُوا الجَنَّة حَتَّى تُؤمِنُوا، وَ لَا تُؤمِنُوا حَتَّى تَحَابُّوا، أَوَلَا أدُلُّكُمْ عَلَى شَيْءٍ إذَا فَعَلْتُمُوهُ تَحَابَبْتُمْ، أَفْشُوا السَّلامَ بَيْنَكُمْ»
en_translation: The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said: 'Y'ou shall not enter paradise until you believe, and you shall not believe until you love one another. Shall I not inform you of something, if you were to act upon it, you will indeed achieve mutual love for one another? Spread the Salâm amongst yourselves.'
subtitle: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting #1

ar_dua: قَالَ عمار بن ياسر(رضي الله عنه): «ثَلاثٌ مَنْ جَمَعَهُنَّ فَقَدْ جَمَعَ الإيْمَانَ: الإنْصَافُ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ، و بَذْلُ السَّلامِ لِلْعَالَمِ، و الإنْفَاقُ مِنَ الإقْتَارِ»
en_translation: 'Ammâr bin Yâsir (RadiAllah ʻanhu) said: 'Three characteristics, whoever combines them, has completed his faith: to be just, to spread greetings to all people and to spend (charitably) out of the little you have.'
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [Before hadith[28]](1/82).
subtitle: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting #2

ar_dua: وَ عَنْ عَبْدِاللهِ بِنْ عَمْرٍو(رضي الله عنه): «أنَّ رَجُلاً سَأَلَ النَّبِيَّ ﷺ أيُّ الإسْلامِ خَيْرٌ؟» قَالَ: «تُطْعِمُ الطَّعَامَ، وَتَقْرَأُ السَّلامَ عَلَى مَنْ عَرَفْتَ وَ مَنْ لَمْ تَعْرِف»
en_translation: 'Abdullah Ibn 'Amr (RadiAllah ʻanhu) reported that a man asked the Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam): ‘Which Islam is the best?’. He (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) replied : 'Feed (the poor), and greet those whom you know as well as those whom you do not.’
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [12](1/55) and Muslim [39](1/65).
subtitle: Excellence of spreading the Islamic greeting #3

ar_dua: وَ عَلَيْكُمْ
en_translation: And upon you.
subtitle: How to reply to the Salâm of a Kâfir

ar_dua: إذَا سَمِعْتُمْ صِيَاحَ الدِّيَكَةِ فَاسْألُوا اللهَ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ؛ فَإنَّهَا رَأَتْ مَلَكاً، وَ إذَا سَمِعْتُمْ نَهِيْقَ الحِمَارِ فَتَعوَّذُوا بِااللهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ؛ فَإنَّهُ رَأى شَيْطَانًا
en_translation: If you hear the crow of a rooster, ask Allah for his bounty for it has seen an angel and if you hear the braying of a donkey, seek refuge in Allah for it has seen a devil.
subtitle: Supplication after hearing a rooster crow or a donkey bray

ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بِاللهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيْمِ
en_translation: If you hear the barking of dogs or the braying of asses at night, seek refuge in Allah for they see what you do not.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [5103](4/327) and Aĥmad (3/306). Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (3/961).
subtitle: Supplication upon hearing the barking of dogs at night

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ فأَيُّمَا مُؤْمِنٍ سَبَبْتُهُ؛ فَاجْعَلْ ذَلِكَ لَهُ قُرْبَةً إلَيْكَ يَوْمَ القِيَامَةِ
en_translation: O Allah, to any believer whom I have insulted, let that be cause to draw him near to You on the Day of Resurrection.
subtitle: Supplication said for one you have insulted

ar_dua: قَالَ ﷺ: «إذَا كَانَ أحَدُكُمْ مَادِحاً صَاحِبَهُ لَا مَحَالَةَ؛ فَلْيَقُل: أحْسِبُ فُلَانًا: وَ اللهُ حَسِيْبُهُ، وَ لَا أُزَكِّي عَلَى اللهِ أحَداً: أحْسِبُهُ – إنْ كَانَ يَعْلمُ ذَاكَ – كَذَا وَ كَذَا»
en_translation: I deem so-and-so to be…and Allah is his reckoner…and I don’t praise anyone, putting it (i.e. my praising) forward, in front of Allah’s commendation, however I assume him so and so’…(if he knows that of him).
en_reference: Muslim [3000](4/2296) and Al-Bukhârî [2662].
subtitle: The etiquette of praising a fellow Muslim

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ لَا تُؤَاخِذْنِي بِمَا يَقُولُونَ، وَ اغْفِرْ لِي مَا لاَ يَعْلَمُونَ [وَ اجْعَلْنِي خَيْراً مِمَّا يَظُنُّونَ]
en_translation: O Allah, do not punish me for what they say, forgive me for what they do not know (and make me better than what they think of me).
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [Adab Al-Mufrad][761] and Al-Albânî declared its chain Ĥasan in Ŝaĥîĥ Adab Al-Mufrad [585]. What is between the brackets is an extension from Al-Baihaqî [Shu'ab Al-Imân](4/228) through a different way.
subtitle: For the one that has been praised

ar_dua: لَبَّيْكَ اللَّهُمَّ لَبَّيْكَ، لَبَّيْكَ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَكَ لَبَّيْكَ، إِنَّ الْحَمْدَ والنِّعْمَةَ، لَكَ وَالمُلْكَ، لَا شَرِيْكَ لَكَ
en_translation: Here I am O Allah, (in response to Your call), here I am. Here I am, You have no partner, here I am. Verily all praise, grace and sovereignty belong to You. You have no partner.
subtitle: The Talbiyah for the one doing Ĥajj or 'Umra

ar_dua: اللهُ أَكْبَرُ
en_translation: Allah is the greatest.
subtitle: The Takbîr passing the black stone

ar_dua: ﴿رَبَّنَا آتِنَا في الدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وفي الآخِرَةِ حَسَنَةً وقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ﴾
en_translation: O our Lord, grant us the best in this life and the best in the next life, and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.
en_reference:
(1) Abû Dâwud [1892](2/179), Aĥmad (3/411) and Al-Baghawî in Sharĥ As-Sunnah (7/128). Al-Albânî declared it Ĥasan in Ŝaĥîĥ Abû Dâwud (1/354).
(2) Sûrah Al-Baqarah: 201.
subtitle: Between the Yemeni corner and the black stone

ar_dua: لَمَّا دَنَا النَّبِيُّ ﷺ مِنَ الصَّفَا قَرَأ: ﴿إنَّ الصَّفَا وَ المَرْوَةَ مِنْ شَعَائِرِ اللهِ﴾«أبْدَأ بِمَا بَدَأ اللهُ بِهِ» فَبَدأ بِالصَّفَا، فَرَقِيَ عَلَيْهِ، حَتَّى رَأَى البَيْتَ، فَاسْتَقْبَلَ القِبْلَةَ، فَوَحَّدَ اللهَ، وَ كَبَّرَهُ، وَ قَالَ: «لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ المُلْكُ وَ لَهُ الحَمْدُ، وَ هُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ، لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهٌ وَ حْدَهُ، أنْجَزَ وَعْدَهُ، وَ نَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ، وَ هَزَمَ الأَحْزَابَ وَحْدَهُ، ثُمَّ دَعَا بَيْنَ ذَلِكَ، قَالَ مِثْلَ هَذَا ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ...، الحَدِيْثُ، وَ فِيْهِ: فَفَعَلَ عَلَى المَرْوَةِ كَمَا فَعَلَ عَلَى الصَّفَا»
en_translation: Indeed Safa and Marwah are from the places of worship of Allah…None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, Allah is the greatest. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner.To Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things amnipotent. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah alone. He fulfilled His promise, aided His Servant and single-handedly defeated the allies.
subtitle: When at Mount Ŝaffâ and Mount Marwah

ar_dua: لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ المُلْكُ، ولَهُ الحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيْرٌ
en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs all praise and sovereignty and He is over all things omnipotent.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3585]. Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/184) and Al-Aĥâdîth Aŝ-Ŝaĥîĥah (4/6).
subtitle: On the Day of 'Arafah

ar_dua: رَكِبَ ﷺ القَصْوَاءَ حَتَّى أتَى المَشْعَرَ الحَرَامَ، فَاسْتَقْبَلَ القِبْلَةَ (فَدَعَاهُ، وَ كَبَّرَهُ، وَ هَلَّلَهُ، وَ وَحَّدَهُ) فَلَمْ يَزَلْ وَاقِفًا حَتَّى أسْفَرَ جِدّاً، فَدَفَعَ قَبْلَ أنْ تَطْلُعَ الشَّمْسُ
en_translation: The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) rode Al-Qaswa until he reached Al-Mash'ar Al-Haram, he then faced the qiblah, supplicated to Allah, and extoled His greatness and oneness. He stood until the sun shone but left before it rose.
subtitle: At the Sacred Site (Al-Mash'ar Al-Harâm)

ar_dua: يُكَبِّرُ كُلَّمَا رَمَى بِحَصَاةٍ عِنْدَ الجِمَارِ الثَّلاثِ، ثُمَّ يَتَقَدَّمُ، وَ يَقِفُ يَدْعُوْ مُسْتَقْبِلَ القِبْلَةَ، رَافِعاً يَدَيْهِ بَعْدَ الجَمْرَةِ الأوْلَى وَ الثَّانِيَةِ، أمَّا جَمْرَةُ العَقَبَةِ فَيَرْمِيْهَا، وَ يُكَبِّرُ عِنْدَ كُلِّ حَصَاةٍ، وَ يَنْصَرِفُ، وَ لَا يَقِفُ عِنْدَهَا
en_translation: Al-Bukhârî [1752 and 1753](3/583-584), also see its wording there, Al-Bukhârî [1750](3/581) and Muslim [1296] narrated it as well from the ḥadīth of Ibn Mas'ûd (RA).
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [1752, 1753](3/583-584) and see his wording there, Al-Bukhârî [1750](3/581) and Muslim [1296].
subtitle: Supplication for throwing a pebble at the Jamarât

ar_dua: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ!
en_translation: How perfect is Allah!
subtitle: What to say at times of amazement and delight #1

ar_dua: اللهُ أَكْبَرُ
en_translation: Allah is the greatest.
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî [4741](8/441). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (2/103),(2/235) and Aĥmad (5/218).
subtitle: What to say at times of amazement and delight #2

ar_dua: كَانَ النَّبِيُّ ﷺ إذَا أتَاهُ أَمْرٌ يَسُرُّهُ أَوْ يُسَرُّ بِهِ؛ خَرَّ سَاجِداً شُكْراً لله تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى
en_translation: The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) would prostrate in gratitude to Allah upon receiving news which pleased him or which caused pleasure.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [2774], At-Tirmidhî [1578] and Ibn Mâjah [1394]. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Ibn Mâjah (1/233) and Irwâ'-ul-Ghalîl (2/226).
subtitle: What to do upon receiving pleasant news

ar_dua:
بِسْمِ اللهِ (ثَلاثاً)
أَعُوذُ بِاللهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا أَجِدُ وَأُحَاذِرُ.(سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ)
en_translation: Recite 'In the name of Allah.' (three times) followed by ''I take refuge in Allah and within His omnipotence from the evil that I feel and am wary of.' (seven times).
subtitle: What to say and do when feeling some pain in the body

ar_dua: اللَّهُمَّ بَارِك عَلَيْهِ
en_translation: If you see something from your brother, yourself or wealth which you find impressing, then invoke blessings for it, for the evil eye is indeed true.
en_reference: Aĥmad (4/447), Ibn Mâjah [3509] and Mâlik [1697-1698]. Al-Albânî authenticated it in Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [556](1/212). Also see research of Zâd al-Ma'âd by Al-Arnâ'ûť.
subtitle: What to say when in fear of afflicting something or someone with one's eye

ar_dua: لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ
en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah.
subtitle: What to say when startled

ar_dua: بِسْمِ اللهِ واللهُ أَكْبَرُ [اللَّهُمَّ مِنْكَ ولَكَ] اللَّهُمَّ تَقَبَّلْ مِنِّي
en_translation: In the name of Allah, and Allah is the greatest. O Allah, (it is) from You and belongs to You, O Allah, accept this from me.
en_reference: Muslim [1966](3/1557) and Baihaqî (9/287). What is between the brackets is from Baihaqî and others.
subtitle: When slaughtering or offering a sacrifice

ar_dua: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ، الَّتِي لَا يُجَاوِزُهُنَّ بَرٌّ ولَا فَاجِرٌ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلقَ، وبَرَأَ وذَرَأَ، ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ، وِمنْ شَرِّ مَا يَعْرُجُ فِيْهَا، ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا ذَرَأَ فِي الأَرْضِ، ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا، وِمنْ شَرِّ فِتَنِ اللَّيْلِ والنَّهَارِ، ومِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ طَارِقٍ إِلَّا طَارِقاً يَطْرُقُ بِخَيْرٍ يَا رَحْمَنُ
en_translation: I take refuge within Allah’s perfect words which no righteous or unrighteous person can transgress, from all the evil that He has created, made and originated. (I take refuge) from the evil that descends from the sky and the evil that rises up to it. (I take refuge) from the evil that is spread on Earth and the evil that springs from her, and I take refuge from the evil of the tribulations of night and day, and the evil of one who visits at night except the one who brings good, O Merciful One.
en_reference: Aĥmad (3/419) with a Ŝaĥîĥ chain, Ibn As-Sunnî [637]. Al-Arnâ'ûť declared its chain Ŝaĥîĥ in his research of Ať-Ťaĥawiyyah (pg. 133). Also see Majma' Az-Zawâ'id (10/127).
subtitle: What is said to ward off the deception of the Obstinate Shaytaans

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «وَ اللهِ إِنِّي لأسْتَغْفِرُ اللهَ وَ أ تُوبُ إلَيْهِ فِي اليَوْمِ أكثَرَ مِنْ سَبْعِيْنَ مَرَّةٍ»
en_translation: The Messenger of Allah (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said : 'By Allah, I seek forgiveness and repent to Allah, more than seventy times a day.'
subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #1

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ تُوبُوا إلَى اللهِ، فَإِنِّي أتُوبُ إلَيْهِ مِئَةَ مَرَّةٍ»
en_translation: The Messenger of Allah (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said : ‘O People, Repent! Verily I repent to Allah, a hundred times a day.'
subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #2

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «مَنْ قَالَ أسْتَغْفِرُ اللهَ العَظِيْمَ الَّذِي لَا إلَهَ إلَّا هُوَ الحَيُّ القَيُّومُ وَ أتُوبُ إلَيْهِ، غَفَرَ للهُ لَهُ، وَ إنْ كَانَ فَرَّ مِنَ الزَّحْفِ»
en_translation: I seek Allah’s forgiveness, besides whom, none has the right to be worshipped except He, The Ever Living, The Self-Subsisting and Supporter of all, and I turn to Him in repentance.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [1517](2/85), At-Tirmidhî [3577](5/569), Al-Hâkim (1/511)  and he authenticated it and Adh-Dhahabî agreed with him. Al-Albânî authenticated it, see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/182) and Al-Jâmi' Al-'Uŝûl Li-Ahâdîth Al-Rasûl (4/389-390) with research by Arnâ'ûť.
subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #3

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «أقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الرَّبُّ مِنَ العَبْدِ، فِي جَوْفِ اللَّيْلِ الآخِرِ؛ فَإنْ اسْتَطَعْتَ أنْ تَكُونَ مِمَّنْ يَذْكُرُ اللهَ فِي تِلْكَ السَّاعَةِ؛ فَكُنْ»
en_translation: The Messenger of Allah (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said : ‘The nearest the Lord comes to His servant is in the middle of the night, so if you are able to be of those who remember Allah at that time, then be so.'
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3579], An-Nisâ'i (1/279), and Al-Hâkim. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/183) and Al-Jâmi' Al-'Uŝûl Li-Ahâdîth Al-Rasûl (4/144) with research by Arnâ'ûť.
subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #4

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «أقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ العَبْدُ مِنْ رَبِّهِ، وَ هُوَ سَاجِدٌ فَأكْثِرُوا الدُّعَاءَ»
en_translation: The Messenger of Allah (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said : ‘The nearest a servant is to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so supplicate much therein'.
subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #5

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «إنَّهُ لَيُغَانُ عَلَى قَلْبِي، وَ إنِّي لأسْتَغْفِرُ اللهَ فِي اليَوْمِ مِئَةَ مَرَّةٍ»
en_translation: The Messenger of Allah (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said: ‘Verily my heart becomes preoccupied, and verily I seek Allah’s forgiveness a hundred times a day.'
en_reference: Muslim [2702](4/2075). Also see Al-Jâmi' Al-'Uŝûl Li-Ahâdîth Al-Rasûl (4/386).
subtitle: Seeking forgiveness and repentance #6

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «مَنْ قَالَ: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ وَ بِحَمْدِهِ فِي يَومٍ مِئَةَ مَرَّةٍ، حُطَّتْ خَطَايَاهُ، وَ لَو كَانَتْ مِثْلَ زَبَدِ البَحْرِ»
en_translation: How perfect Allah is and I praise Him. (One Hundred times daily)
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #1

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «مَنْ قَالَ: لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ المُلْكُ، وَ لَهُ الحَمْدُ، وَ هُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ عَشْرَ مِرَارٍ، كَانَ كَمَنْ أعْتَقَ أرْبَعَةَ أنْفُسٍ مِنْ وَلَدِ إسْمَاعِيلَ»
en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. (Ten times)
en_reference: Al-Bukhârî (7/67) and Muslim (4/2017).
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #2

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «كَلِمَتَانِ خَفِيفَتَانِ عَلَى اللِّسَانِ، ثَقِيلَتَانِ فِي الِميْزَانِ، حَبِيبَتَانِ إلَى الرَّحْمَنِ: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ وَ بِحَمْدِهِ، سُبْحَانَ اللهِ العَظِيْمِ»
en_translation: The Messenger of Allah (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said: "There are two words (phrases), (which are) light on the tongue, heavy on the scale and beloved to The Most Gracious: 'How perfect Allah is and I praise Him.' (and) 'How perfect Allah is, The Supreme.'
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #3

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «لَأنْ أقُولَ: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ، وَ الحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، وَ لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ، وَ اللهُ أكْبَرُ، أحَبُّ إلَيَّ مِمَّا طَلَعَتْ عَلَيْهِ الشَّمْسُ»
en_translation: The Messenger of Allah (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said : "Saying 'How perfect Allah is, and all praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, and Allah is the greatest', is more beloved to me than everything the Sun has risen over.
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #4

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «أيَعْجِزُ أحَدُكُمْ أنْ يَكْسِبَ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ ألْفَ حَسَنَةٍ» فَسَألَهُ سَائِلٌ مِنْ جُلَسَائِهِ: كَيْفَ يَكْسِبُ أحَدُنَا ألْفَ حَسَنَةٍ؟ قَالَ: «يُسَبِّحُ مِئَةَ تَسْبِيْحَةٍ، فَيُكْتَبُ لَهُ ألْفُ حَسَنَةٍ، أوْ يُحَطُّ عَنْهُ ألْفُ خَطِيْئَةٍ»
en_translation: How perfect Allah is and I praise Him. (One Hundred times)
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #5

ar_dua: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ: «مَنْ قَالَ: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ العَظِيمِ وَ بِحَمْدِهِ، غُرِسَتْ لَهُ نَخْلَةٌ فِي الجَنَّةِ»
en_translation: Whoever says: 'How perfect Allah is, The Supreme, and I praise Him', a palm tree is planted for him in paradise.
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3464-3465](5/511), Al-Hâkim (1/501) and he authenticated it and Adh-Dhahabî agreed with him. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [6429](5/531) and Ŝaĥîĥ At-Tirmidhî (3/160).
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #6

ar_dua: قَالَ ﷺ: «يَا عَبْدَاللهِ بْنَ قَيْسٍ، ألَا أدُلُّكَ عَلَى كَنْزٍ مِنْ كُنُوزِ الجَنَّةِ؟» فَقُلْتُ: بَلَى يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ، قَالَ: «قُلْ لَا حَوْلَ وَ لَا قُوَّةَ إلَّا بِااللهِ»
en_translation: There is no might nor power except with Allah.
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #7

ar_dua: قَالَ ﷺ: «أحَبُّ الكَلَامِ إلَى اللهِ أرْبَعٌ: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ، وَ الحَمْدُ للهِ، وَ لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ، وَ اللهُ أكْبَرُ، لَا يَضُرُّكَ بِأيِّهِنَّ بَدَأْتَ»
en_translation: The Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) said: "Four phrases are beloved to Allah: 'How perfect Allah is', 'All praises are for Allah', 'None has the right to be worshipped except Allah', and 'Allah is the greatest.'"
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #8

ar_dua: جَاءَ أعْرَابِيٌّ إلَى رَسُولُ اللهِ ﷺ فَقَالَ: عَلِّمْنِي كَلَامًا أقُولُهُ؟ قَالَ: «قُلْ: لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ وَ حْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، اللهُ أكْبَرُ كَبِيْراً، وَ الحَمْدُ للهِ كَثِيْراً، سُبْحَانَ اللهِ رَبِّ العَالَمِيْنَ، لَا حَوْلَ وَ لَا قُوَّةَ إلَّا بِااللهِ العَزِيزِ الحَكِيمِ»، قَالَ: فَهَؤُلَاءِ لِرَبِّي فَمَا لِي؟ قَالَ: «قُلْ: اللهم اغْفِرلِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، واهْدِنِي، وَارْزُقْنِي»
en_translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone without partener. Allah is most great and much praise is for Allah. How perfect Allah is, Lord of the worlds. There is no might nor power except with Allah, The Exalted in might, The Wise. O Allah, forgive me, have mercy upon me, guide me and grant me sustenance.
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #9

ar_dua: كَانَ الرَّجُلُ إذَا أَسْلَمَ عَلَّمَهُ النَّبِيُّ ﷺ الصَّلَاةَ، ثُمَّ أمَرَهُ أنْ يَدْعُوَ بِهَؤُلَاءِ الكَلِمَاتِ: «اللهم اغْفِرْلِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وِ عَافِنِي، وَارْزُقْنِي»
en_translation: O Allah, forgive me, have mercy upon me, guide me, give me health and grant me sustenance.
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #10

ar_dua: إنَّ أفْضَلَ الدُّعَاءِ: الحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، وَ أفْضَلُ الذِّكْرِ: لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ
en_translation: Indeed the best du'â (is): 'All praise is for Allah.' and the best remembrance (is): 'None has the right to be worshipped except Allah.'
en_reference: At-Tirmidhî [3383](5/462), Ibn Mâjah [3800](2/1249), and Al-Hâkim (1/503) and he authenticated it and Adh-Dhahabî agreed with him. Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [1104](1/362).
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #11

ar_dua: البَاقِيَاتُ الصَّالِحَاتُ: سُبْحَانَ اللهِ، وَ الحَمْدُللهِ، وَ لَا إلَهَ إلَّا اللهُ، وَ اللهُ أكْبَرُ، وَ لَا حَوْلَ وَ لَا قُوَّةَ إلَّا بِااللهِ
en_translation: How perfect Allah is, and all praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, and Allah is the greatest. There is no might nor power except with Allah.
en_reference: Aĥmad [513](3/75) according to the order of Aĥmad Shâkir and its chain is authentic. Also see Majma' Az-Zawâ'id (1/297)..... [COMPLETE THIS]
subtitle: Excellence of At-Tasbîĥ, At-Taĥmîd, At-Tahlîl and At-Takbîr #12

ar_dua: عَنْ عَبْدِ اللهِ بْنِ عَمْروٍ قَالَ: رَأيْتُ النَّبِيَّ يَعْقِدُ التَّسْبِيْحَ بِيَمِيْنِهِ
en_translation: 'Abdullah ibn 'Amr (RadiAllah ʻanhu) said : I saw the Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) make tasbeeh with his right hand.
en_reference: Abû Dâwud [1502](2/81) and At-Tirmidhî [3486](5/521). Also see Ŝaĥîĥ Al-Jâmi' [4865](4/271).
subtitle: How the Prophet (salla Allaahu ʻalayhi wa salaam) made tasbîĥ?

ar_dua: إذَا كَانَ جُنْحُ اللَّيْل – أوْ أمْسَيْتُم – فَكُفُّوا صِبْيَانَكُمْ؛ فَإنَّ الشَّيَاطِيْنَ تَنْتَشِرُ حِيْنَئَذٍ، فَإذَا ذَهَبَ سَاعَةٌ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَخَلُّوهُمْ، وَأغْلقُوا الأبْوَابَ، وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللهِ؛ فَإنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ لَا يَفْتَحُ بَابًا مُغْلَقًا، وَ أوْكُوا قِرَبَكُمْ، وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللهِ، وَ خَمِّرُوا آنِيَتَكُمْ وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللهِ، وَ لَوْ أنْ تَعْرِضُوا عَلَيْهَا شَيْئًا، وَ أطْفِئُوا مَصَابِيْحَكُمْ
en_translation: When night falls, restrain your children (from going out) because at such time the devils spread about. After a period of time has passed, let them be. Shut your doors and mention Allah’s name, for verily the devil does not open a shut door, tie up your water-skins and mention Allah’s name, cover your vessels with anything and mention Allah’s name and put out your lamps.
subtitle: General and Beneficial rules
